curam.util.common.message
Interface LocalizedMessage

All Superinterfaces:
CustomMessage, Message
public interface LocalizedMessage
extends CustomMessage

An interface that defines a message that has already been localized. A LocalizedMessage may or may not have a valid message ID (zero is considered "unset") but can return the localized message string. The locale used for localization is accessible via LocalizedMessage.getLocale(). A MessageBuilder can be used to substitute the arguments for the argument placeholders in the message after localization. The interface extends CustomMessage to allow the localized message to preserve the message identifier integer or string from the original message.
